intro: Adoceton, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have simple, opposite leaves and produce small, clustered flowers that are often white or yellow. Adoceton species are characterized by their attractive, often fragrant blossoms and their ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. They are sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their aesthetic appeal.
